intro: Eriochaeta secundiflora, commonly known as the clustered eriochaeta, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often with a rough texture. Eriochaeta secundiflora is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
